Topic.Title: Setting an attribute string value to blank

Posts.EditableText:
Hello!

I should like my game to permit people to select a title of address, and I would like the option to set that title to be blank if they would prefer no title.  For example:

{title} {firstname} {lastname} is neat.

Should ideally read:

Miss Jane Doe is neat.

or

Mister John Doe is neat.

or 

John Doe is neat.

Is there any way to do this? I can't seem to get it to do anything but 

null John Doe is neat.

Thanks in advance.
Posts.HTML:
Hello!

I should like my game to permit people to select a title of address, and I would like the option to set that title to be blank if they would prefer no title. For example:

{title} {firstname} {lastname} is neat.

Should ideally read:

Miss Jane Doe is neat.

or

Mister John Doe is neat.

or

John Doe is neat.

Is there any way to do this? I can't seem to get it to do anything but

null John Doe is neat.

Thanks in advance.

You could set the 'title' attribute to something invisible.
For example:

@set title= 
@set name=Smith
{title} {name}

Posts.EditableText: Thank you! I knew it would be a simple solution.
Posts.HTML: Thank you! I knew it would be a simple solution.

Posts.EditableText: Hmm, in an attempt to give you a clean example of my code (minus irrelevant story details) it seems to work now. I am having a great deal of trouble getting my javascript to run properly in Squiffy.  Without it, @set title worked exactly as described instead of showing 'null smith'.  Sorry for the trouble! Looks like my code was the bug.
